publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Potential years of life lost (PYLL) from causes considered amenable to healthcare (CCGOIS 1.1)
description:
Potential years of life lost (PYLL) rate from causes considered amenable to healthcare.



The following indicator includes a change of methodology for the pooled years directly standardised rate and for the confidence intervals for all breakdowns.

Full details of these changes can be found here: http://www.hscic.gov.uk/pubs/methchanges

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Under 75 mortality rates from cardiovascular disease (CCGOIS 1.2)
description:
Directly age and sex standardised mortality rate from cardiovascular disease for people aged under 75 in the respective calendar year per 100,000 registered patients.

Current version updated: Sep-14

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Myocardial infarction, stroke and stage 5 chronic kidney disease in people with diabetes (CCGOIS 1.4)
description:
Indirectly age and sex standardised ratio for myocardial infarction, stroke and stage 5 chronic kidney disease in people with diabetes.

Current version updated: Mar-15

Next version due: Mar-16

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Mortality within 30 days of hospital admission for stroke (CCGOIS 1.5)
description:
The casemix adjusted standardised mortality ratio of people with known stroke type who die within 30 days of hospital admission.

Current version updated: Jan-15

Next version due: Dec-15

Directly age and sex standardised mortality rate from cancer for people aged under 75 in the respective calendar year per 100,000 registered patients.

One-year net survival for adults diagnosed with cancer.

description:
One-year net survival for adults diagnosed with breast, lung or colorectal cancer.

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Antenatal assessments within 13 weeks (CCGOIS 1.13)
description:
The percentage of women who have seen a midwife or a maternity healthcare professional by 12 weeks and 6 days of pregnancy.

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Maternal smoking at delivery (CCGOIS 1.14)
description:
The percentage of women who were smokers at the time of delivery, out of the number of maternities.

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Breast feeding prevalence at 6 - 8 weeks (CCGOIS 1.15)
description:
The percentage of infants who are breastfed at 6-8 weeks of age, out of the number of infants due a 6-8 week check with 95% confidence intervals.

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Record of stage of cancer at diagnosis (CCGOIS 1.17)
description:
The percentage of new cases of cancer for which a valid stage is recorded at the time of diagnosis.

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Jun-16

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Percentage of cancers detected at stage 1 and 2 (CCGOIS 1.18)
description:
The percentage of new cases of cancer which were diagnosed at stage 1 or 2 for the specific cancer sites, morphologies and behaviour: invasive malignancies of breast, prostate, colorectal, lung, bladder, kidney, ovary, uterus, non-Hodgkin lymphoma and invasive melanomas of skin.



This indicator relates to a subset of the cancers covered by CCG indicator 1.17 Record of stage of cancer at diagnosis.

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Jun-16

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Record of lung cancer stage at decision to treat (CCGOIS 1.19)
description:
The percentage of cases of lung cancer for which a valid stage at the time of decision to treat is recorded.

Current version updated: Mar-15

Next version due: Mar-16

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Mortality from breast cancer in females (CCGOIS 1.20)
description:
Directly age standardised mortality rate from breast cancer for females in the respective time period per 100,000 registered female patients.

Current version updated: Sep-14

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: All-cause mortality – 12 months following a first emergency admission to hospital for heart failure in people aged 16 and over (CCGOIS 1.21)
description:
Indirectly age and sex standardised ratio of deaths that occur in the 12 months following a person’s first emergency admission episode with a primary diagnosis of heart failure in a three year period in people aged 16 and over. A person’s first emergency admission episode is determined by selecting the earliest admission date for each unique patient identifier.

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Mar-16

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Hip fracture: incidence (CCGOIS 1.22)
description:
Directly age and sex standardised emergency admission rate for hip fracture in those aged 60 years and over, per 100,000 registered patients.

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Health-related quality of life for people with long-term conditions (CCGOIS 2.1)
description:
Average adjusted health status (EQ-5D™) score for individuals reporting that they have a long-term condition, based on responses to a question from the GP Patient Survey.

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Proportion of people who are feeling supported to manage their condition (CCGOIS 2.2)
description:
Proportion of people feeling supported to manage their long-term conditions, based on responses to one question from the GP Patient Survey.

Next version due: Sep-15

description:

Average adjusted health status (EQ-5D™) score for individuals reporting that they have a long-term mental health condition, based on responses to a question from the GP Patient Survey.

title: Emergency admissions for acute conditions that should not usually require hospital admission (CCGOIS 3.1)
description:
Directly age and sex standardised rate of unplanned hospital admissions for acute conditions for persons of all ages.

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Emergency readmissions within 30 days of discharge from hospital (CCGOIS 3.2)
description:
Percentage of emergency admissions to any hospital in England occurring within 30 days of the last, previous discharge from hospital after admission; indirectly standardised by age, sex, method of admission and diagnosis / procedure.  Admissions for cancer and obstetrics are excluded.

Current version updated: Mar-14

Next version due: TBC

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Patient reported outcomes measures (PROMS) for elective procedures (CCGOIS 3.3)
description:
Patients reported improvement in health status following elective procedures, currently covering groin hernia, hip replacement, knee replacement and varicose veins. The PROMs indicators is reported separately for the four conditions.

Current version updated: Sep-14

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Emergency admissions for children with lower respiratory tract infections (CCGOIS 3.4)
description:
Directly age and sex standardised rate of children under 19 (0 to 18 years) admitted to hospital with lower respiratory tract infections as an emergency admission.

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: People who have had a stroke who are admitted to an acute stroke unit within 4 hours of arrival to hospital (CCGOIS 3.5)
description:
Percentage of people with stroke admitted to an acute stroke unit within 4 hours of arrival to hospital.

Current version updated: Dec-14

Next version due: Dec-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: People who have had an acute stroke who receive thrombolysis (CCGOIS 3.6)
description:
The percentage of people who have had an acute stroke that receive thrombolysis.

Next version due: Dec-15

description:
The percentage of people with stroke discharged from hospital with a joint health and social care plan.

Current version updated: Dec-14

Next version due: Dec-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: People who have a follow-up assessment between 4 and 8 months after initial admission for stroke (CCGOIS 3.8)
description:
The percentage of people who have a follow-up assessment between 4 and 8 months after initial admission for stroke.

Current version updated: Dec-14

Next version due: Dec-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: People who have had an acute stroke who spend 90% or more of their stay on a stroke unit (CCGOIS 3.9)
description:
Of the people who have had an acute stroke, the percentage that spend 90% or more of their hospital inpatient stay on a stroke unit.

Next version due: Dec-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Hip fracture: proportion of patients recovering to their previous levels of mobility/walking ability at 30 days (CCGOIS 3.10.i)
description:
The proportion of patients, expressed as a percentage, with a hip fracture recovering to their previous levels of mobility at 30 days.

Current version updated: Dec-14

Next version due: Dec-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Hip fracture: proportion of patients recovering to their previous levels of mobility/walking ability at 120 days (CCGOIS 3.10.ii)
description:
The proportion of patients, expressed as a percentage, with a hip fracture recovering to their previous levels of mobility at 120 days.

Current version updated: Dec-14

Next version due: Dec-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Hip fracture: collaborative orthogeriatric care (CCGOIS 3.11)
description:
Of people with hip fracture, the percentage who received collaborative orthogeriatric care from admission evidenced as having a joint acute care protocol at admission, and evidence of Multi-Disciplinary Team (MDT) rehabilitation agreed with a responsible orthogeriatrician and orthopaedic surgeon, with General Medical Council (GMC) numbers recorded.

Current version updated: Dec-14

Next version due: Dec-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Hip fracture: timely surgery (CCGOIS 3.12)
description:
Of people with hip fracture, the proportion who receive surgery on the day of, or the day after, admission.

Current version updated: Dec-14

Next version due: Dec-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Hip fracture: multifactorial falls risk assessment (CCGOIS 3.13)
description:
Of people with hip fracture, the percentage who receive a multifactorial risk assessment of future falls risk, led by the hip fracture programme team evidenced by General Medical Council (GMC) number of responsible clinician.

Current version updated: Dec-14

Next version due: Dec-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Alcohol-specific hospital admissions (CCGOIS 3.14)
description:
Directly age and sex standardised admission rate for alcohol-specific conditions per 100,000 registered patients.

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Emergency alcohol-specific readmission to any hospital within 30 days of discharge following an alcohol-specific admission (CCGOIS 3.15)
description:
Indirectly age and sex standardised ratio of emergency readmissions with a primary diagnosis or an external cause code of an alcohol-specific condition within 30 days of a previous discharge following an alcohol-specific admission.

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Unplanned readmissions to mental health services within 30 days of a mental health inpatient discharge in people aged 17 and over (CCGOIS 3.16)
description:
Indirectly age and sex standardised ratio of unplanned readmissions to a mental health service within 30 days of a discharge from a mental health inpatient service in people aged 17 and over.

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Percentage of adults in contact with secondary mental health services in employment (CCGOIS 3.17)
description:
The percentage of working age adults aged 18 to 69, who have an open spell at the end of March for the relevant financial year, whose record of employment associated with their most recent assessment, formal review, or other multi-disciplinary care planning meeting in the previous 12 months indicated that they were employed

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Patient experience of GP out-of-hours services (CCGOIS 4.1)
description:
Patient experience of GP out-of-hours services, measured by scoring the results of one question from the GP Patient Survey.

Current version updated: Dec-14

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Patient experience of hospital care (CCGOIS 4.2)
description:
Patient experience of hospital care measured by scoring the results of a selection of questions from the National Inpatient Survey looking at a range of elements of hospital care.

Current version updated: Sep-14

Next version due: TBC

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Responsiveness to Inpatients personal needs (CCGOIS 4.5)
description:
Patient experience measured by scoring the results of a selection of questions from the National Inpatient Survey focussing on the responsiveness to personal needs.

Current version updated: Sep-14

Next version due: TBC

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Patient safety incidents (CCGOIS 5.1)
description:
For each of a CCG’s five main providers, this indicator shows the rate of Patient Safety incidents per 1,000 total provider bed days.

Current version updated: Mar-15

Next version due: Dec-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Incidence of Healthcare Associated Infection (HCAI) – Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) (CCGOIS 5.3)
description:
The count of MRSA bloodstream infections reported per CCG.

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Sep-15

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Incidence of Healthcare Associated Infection (HCAI) – C. difficile (CCGOIS 5.4)
description:
The count of C. difficile infections reported, in people aged 2 and over, per CCG.

Current version updated: Jun-15

Next version due: Sep-15
